member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.ColorimetricToDeviceColors
member.summary: Returns the appropriate XYZ colors in response to the specified number of colors, channels, device colors and the proprietary plug-in algorithms.
member.param: The number of colors in the pXYZColors and pDeviceValues arrays.
The number of color channels in the pDeviceValues arrays.
The pointer to the array of incoming XYZColors to convert to device colors.
The pointer to an array that contains the resulting outgoing device color values.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.ColorimetricToDeviceColorsWithBlack
member.summary: Returns the appropriate device colors in response to the incoming number of colors, channels, black information, Commission Internationale l'Eclairge XYZ (CIEXYZ) colors and the proprietary plug-in algorithms.
member.param: The number of colors in the pXYZColors and pDeviceValues arrays.
The number of color channels in the pDeviceValues arrays.
A pointer to the array of outgoing structures.
A pointer to the .
A pointer to the array of incoming device colors that are to be converted to structures.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL. For extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.DeviceToColorimetricColors
member.summary: Returns the appropriate XYZ colors in response to the specified number of colors, channels, device colors and the proprietary plug-in algorithms.
member.param: The number of colors in the pXYZColors and pDeviceValues arrays.
The number of color channels in the pDeviceValues arrays.
A pointer to the array of outgoing XYZColors.
A pointer to the array of incoming device colors to convert to XYZColors.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL. For extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.GetGamutBoundaryMesh
member.summary: Returns the triangular mesh from the plug-in. This function is used to compute the GamutBoundaryDescription.
member.param: The number of channels.
The number of vertices.
The number of triangles.
A pointer to the array of vertices in the plug-in model gamut shell.
A pointer to the array of triangles in the plug-in model gamut shell.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.GetGamutBoundaryMeshSize
member.summary: Returns the required data structure sizes for the GetGamutBoundaryMesh function.
member.param: The required number of vertices.
The required number of triangles.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If the plug-in device model wants WCS to compute its gamut boundary mesh, the return value is S_FALSE.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.GetNeutralAxis
member.summary: The return the XYZ colorimetry of sample points along the device's neutral axis.
member.param: The number of points that are returned.
A pointer to an array of structures.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.GetNeutralAxisSize
member.summary: The function returns the number of data points along the neutral axis that are returned by the GetNeutralAxis function. It is provided so that a Color Management Module (CMM) can allocate an appropriately sized buffer.
member.param: The number of points that will be returned by a call to GetNeutralAxis. Minimum is 2 (black and white).

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.GetNumChannels
member.summary: Returns the number of device channels in the parameter pNumChannels.
member.param: A pointer to an unsigned integer representing the number of color channels for your device.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.GetPrimarySamples
member.summary: Returns the measurement color for the primary sample.
member.param: The primary color type, which is determined by using the hue circle order. If the plugin device model does not natively support primaries for red, yellow, green, cyan, blue, magenta, black and white, it must still return virtual primary data.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.Initialize
member.summary: Takes a pointer to a Stream that contains the whole device model plug-in as input, and initializes any internal parameters required by the plug-in.
member.param: A string that contains the BSTR XML device model plug-in profile. This parameter stores data as little-endian Unicode XML; however, it may have no leading bytes to tag it as such. Also, the encoding keyword in the XML may not reflect that this is formatted as little-endian Unicode. Furthermore, due to the action of the MSXML engine, the BSTR XML file is processed and might not have exactly the same contents as the original XML file.
The number of total models in the transform sequence.
The one-based model position of the other device model in the workflow of uiNumModels as provided in the Initialize function.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL.

member.name: IDeviceModelPlugIn.SetTransformDeviceModelInfo
member.summary: Provides the plug-in with parameters to determine where in the transform sequence the specific plug-in occurs.
member.param: The one-based model position of the other device model in the workflow of uiNumModels, as provided in the Initialize function.
A pointer to a IDeviceModelPlugIn interface that contains the other device model in the transform sequence.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, the return value is S_OK.
If this function fails, the return value is E_FAIL.

summary.para: Describes the methods that are defined for the IDeviceModelPlugIn Component Object Model (COM) interface.
